result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis P Worth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/court costs due by 05/31/16.  Failure to make payments when due will result in 1 day in the Ozaukee Co Jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit to a DNA sample at the Ozaukee Co Sheriff's Dept by 04/08/16.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dennis P Worth
Current: 240 Main Street Apt. #204, Belgium, WI 53004 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2016)
Prior: 680 County Road D # 8, Belgium, WI 53004

Defendant Dennis P Worth in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court breaks for defendant to speak to Attorney Sisley. 11:05 a.m. case recalled; same appearances. Agreement has been reached. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
w/conditions: no operation of a motor vehicle w/o license

Defendant Dennis P Worth in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the complaint. State recommends signature bond and not to operate motor vehicle w/o valid dl. Court sets bail. Defendant wishes to proceed pro se and files waiver of right to attorney. Court examines defendant on waiver and advises defendant of penalties. Pretrial conference scheduled for 02/15/16.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
